00001 #ifndef HW_INIT_H
00002 #define HW_INIT_H

00005 /*
00006 *********************************************************************************************************
00007 *  File: hw_init.h
00008 *  Author: Omer Farooq
00009 *  Version: 1.0
00010 *  Date:  23-January-06
00011 *
00012 *   Header file for MSP430 board
00013 *
00014 *   NOTE: Most of the comments in this file are from orignal msp430x149.s provided
00015 *       by Dr. Philips.
00016 *********************************************************************************************************
00017 */
00018 
00019 /*
00020 *********************************************************************************************************
00021 *                                             INCLUDE FILES
00022 *********************************************************************************************************
00023 */
00024 #include <io.h>
00025 #include <signal.h>
00026 #include <iomacros.h>
00027 
00028 /*
00029 *********************************************************************************************************
00030 *  Port assignments
00031 *  PxDIR:               (0) = Input             (1) = Output    ; Direction
00032 *  PxSEL:               (0) = I/O               (1) = Alt               ; Select
00033 *  P(1|2)IE:    (0) = Disabled  (1) = Enabled   ; Interrupt Enable
00034 *  P(1|2)IES:   (0) = Low->High (1) = High->Low ; Interrupt Edge Select
00035 *  P(1|2)IFG:   (0) = No Int    (1) = Int               ; Interrupt Flag Register
00036 *********************************************************************************************************
00037 */
00038 /*
00039  * Port 1
00040  * Keypad
00041  * P1[0..3] = KP_ROW[0..3] (SW[1..4];SW[5..8];SW[9..12];SW[13..16])
00042  * weak pulldown (10k) to 0V
00043  * Cols on P4[4..7]
00044  */
00045 #define KP_ROW0         0x01
00046 #define KP_ROW1         0x02
00047 #define KP_ROW2         0x04
00048 #define KP_ROW3         0x08
00049 
00050 /*
00051  * Interrupt Request Switches (general purpose)
00052  * P1[6..7] = SW[18..19]
00053  * weak pullup (10k) to 3.3V & filter cap (0.1u) to 0V
00054  */
00055 #define IRQ_SW2         0x40
00056 #define IRQ_SW1         0x80
00057 
00058 /*
00059  * LCD busy flag poll line
00060  * P1.4 = LCD_DB.7
00061  * strong pullup (2.2k) (open collector buffer output) to 3.3V
00062  */
00063 #define LCD_DB7_IN              0x10
00064 #define LCD_BUSY                LCD_DB7_IN
00065 
00066 /* 
00067  * P1.5 = unused
00068  * P1 available via J2
00069  * P1[0..4,6,7] configured as inputs
00070  * P1.5 as output per msp430 documentation for unused port pins
00071  */
00072 #define HW_P1SEL                0x00
00073 #define HW_P1DIR                0x20
00074 #define HW_P1OUT                0x00
00075 #define HW_P1IE             0x00
00076 #define HW_P1IES                0x00
00077 
00078 /*
00079  * P1[0..3] for polling or l->h h->l interrupt key scanning / de-bouncing
00080  * P1.4         for polling or h->l interrupt LCD not busy
00081  * P1[6..7]     for polling or h->l interrupt request / hardware de-bouncing
00082  */
00083 
00084 
00085 /*
00086  * Port 2
00087  * Multiplexed 7-Segment Displays
00088  * P2[0..7] = DISP[(1&(!P3.0))|(2&(!P3.1))] (active low enables on P3[0..1])
00089  * Common anode display interfaced with a 74HC240 inverting buffer
00090  * So the display codes look like common cathode codes
00091  * P2 has interrupt abilities, If 74HC240's is left un-enabled its output is
00092  * open and P2 can be reconfigured as inputs.  You could enable the 74HC240's 
00093  * and the displays will blink (probably faster than you can see) 
00094  */
00095 #define DISP_A   0x01
00096 #define DISP_B   0x02
00097 #define DISP_C   0x04
00098 #define DISP_D   0x08
00099 #define DISP_E   0x10
00100 #define DISP_F   0x20
00101 #define DISP_G   0x40
00102 #define DISP_DP  0x80
00103 
00104 /*
00105  * P2 available via J3
00106  * P2[0..7] configured as outputs
00107  */
00108 #define HW_P2SEL 0x00
00109 #define HW_P2DIR 0xff
00110 #define HW_P2OUT 0x00
00111 #define HW_P2IE  0x00
00112 #define HW_P2IES 0x00
00113 
00114 /*
00115  * Port 3
00116  * Multiplexed 7-Segment Displays
00117  * P3[0..1] = DISP[1..2] enables (active low)
00118  */
00119 #define  DISP1_EN 0x01
00120 #define  DISP2_EN 0x02
00121 
00122 /* P3[2..3] = unused */
00123 
00124 /* 
00125  * UART
00126  * P3[4..7] = UART[Tx0,Rx0,Tx1,Rx1]
00127  * UART lines are sent to RS-232 buffer/driver ([0,3.3]<->[+6,-6])
00128  */
00129 
00130 /*
00131  * P3 available via J5
00132  * P3[0..3,4,6] configured as outputs
00133  * P3[5,7]              configured as inputs
00134  * P3[4..7]             configured as alt (for UART0/1 peripheral)
00135  */
00136 #define  HW_P3SEL 0xf0
00137 #define  HW_P3DIR 0x5f
00138 #define  HW_P3OUT 0x03
00139 
00140 /*
00141  * Port 4
00142  * LCD
00143  * Port 4[0..3] and port 5[0..7] are interfaced to 74LVC07 non-inverting open
00144  * collector buffers with strong pull ups (2.2k) to 5V
00145  * The P4[1..2] are available for their alt function as timer_B
00146  * outputs as long as the LCD enable (P4.0) is left unactive
00147  * P4.3 is also available
00148  * P4.0         = LCD_EN
00149  * P4.1         = LCD_RW
00150  * P4.2         = LCD_RS
00151  */
00152 #define  LCD_EN   0x01
00153 #define  LCD_RW   0x02
00154 #define  LCD_RS   0x04
00155 
00156 /* 
00157  * LED
00158  * P4.3         = LED1
00159  */
00160 #define LED1   0x08
00161 
00162 /* 
00163  * Keypad
00164  * P4[4..7] = KP_COL[0..3]      (SW[1,5,9,13];SW[2,6,10,14];
00165  *            SW[3,7,11,15];SW[4,8,12,16])
00166  */
00167 #define  KP_COL0  0x10
00168 #define  KP_COL1  0x20
00169 #define  KP_COL2  0x40
00170 #define  KP_COL3  0x80
00171 
00172 /* 
00173  * P4 available via J4
00174  * P4[0..7]     configured as outputs
00175  */
00176 #define  HW_P4SEL 0x00
00177 #define  HW_P4DIR 0xff
00178 #define  HW_P4OUT 0x00
00179 
00180 /*
00181  * Port 5
00182  * LCD
00183  * MSP430 Clock signals (buffered) are available on P5[4..6] as alt functions
00184  * P5.4 = MCLK;         P5.5 = SMCLK;   P5.6 = ACLK
00185  * MCLK should be the HFO (7.3728 MHz)
00186  * SMCLK        = MCLK
00187  * ACLK should be the LFO (32.768 KHz)
00188  * ACLK should be left on and used for LPMs
00189  * upon wake up start the DCO = MCLK = SMCLK (DCO has fast startup time)
00190  * start the HFO if need be, do tasks while waiting for HFO to stabilize
00191  * then switch to HFO... I have no idea why I have commented this here.
00192  * P5[0..7]     = LCD_DB[0..7]
00193  */
00194 #define  LCD_DB0_OUT 0x01
00195 #define  LCD_DB1_OUT 0x02
00196 #define  LCD_DB2_OUT 0x04
00197 #define  LCD_DB3_OUT 0x08
00198 #define  LCD_DB4_OUT 0x10
00199 #define  LCD_DB5_OUT 0x20
00200 #define  LCD_DB6_OUT 0x40
00201 #define  LCD_DB7_OUT 0x80
00202 
00203 /* 
00204  * P5 available via J6
00205  * P5[0..7]     configured as outputs
00206  */
00207 #define  HW_P5SEL 0x00
00208 #define  HW_P5DIR 0xff
00209 #define  HW_P5OUT 0x00
00210 
00211 /*
00212  * Port 6
00213  * unused
00214  * P6 available via J7
00215  * P6[0..7]     configured as outputs
00216  */
00217 #define  HW_P6SEL 0x00
00218 #define  HW_P6DIR 0xff
00219 #define  HW_P6OUT 0x00
00220 
00221 /*************************************************************************
00222 *  Memory Map
00223 **************************************************************************/
00224 #define  F_CODE_TOP  0xFFFF
00225 #define  F_IVT_BOT   0xFFE0
00226 #define  F_CODE_BOT  0x1100
00227 
00228 #define  F_INFO_TOP  0x10FF
00229 #define  F_INFO_BOT  0x1000
00230 
00231 #define  BOOT_ROM_TOP   0x0FFF
00232 #define  BOOT_ROM_BOT    0x0C00
00233 
00234 #define  RAM_TOP     0x09ff
00235 #define  RAM_BOT     0x0200
00236 #define  PER16_TOP   0x01FF
00237 #define  PER16_BOT   0x0100
00238 #define  PER8_TOP    0x00ff
00239 #define  PER8_BOT    0x0010
00240 #define  SFR_TOP     0x000f
00241 #define  SFR_BOT     0x0000
00242 
00243 /*************************************************************************
00244 *  WDT modes
00245 **************************************************************************/
00246 #define WDT_OFF     (0x5A00|WDTHOLD)
00247 
00248 /*************************************************************************
00249 *  Stack pointer
00250 **************************************************************************/
00251 #define  INIT_SP  (RAM_TOP+1)
00252 
00253 /*************************************************************************
00254 *  HFO clock sinks
00255 **************************************************************************/
00256 #define INIT_BCSCTL2 (SELM1|SELS)
00257 
00258 /*************************************************************************
00259 *  HFO stabilize timeout
00260 **************************************************************************/
00261 #define HFO_TIMEOUT  0x0FFF
00262   
00263 /*************************************************************************
00264 *  Errno codes
00265 **************************************************************************/
00266 #define  ERR_HFO  0x0001
00267 #define  ERR_LCD  0x0002
00268 #define  ERR_UART0   0x0004
00269 #define  ERR_UART1   0x0008
00270 
00271 /*************************************************************************
00272 *  Errno codes
00273 **************************************************************************/
00274 /*
00275  * 5V stabilize <25ms the 3.3V doesn't matter because the MSP430 has
00276  * a supervisor ic on its reset line.  The 5V does because LCD init can't start
00277  * before the LCD has 4.5V to it, else it doesn't work.
00278  */
00279 #define LCD_PS_WAIT     0xEFFE
00280

00287 #define ONESECOND       512
